snippet: A commission delegation said Wednesday that the the Feb. 14 fire that killed 361 people at the Comayagua national prison was the result of decades of neglect.
abstract: Inter-American Commission on Human Rights says that the conditions that led to the February fire that killed 361 people at the Comayagua national prison, were the result of decades of neglect of Honduras’s prisons and iron-fisted anticrime policies.
